blocks.value: St. Imelda Lambertini was born in Bologna, Italy, in 1322. From a young age, she had an intense desire to receive Holy Communion, but at that time, children were not permitted to receive the Eucharist until they were older.

At the age of 11, while praying before the Blessed Sacrament, a Host miraculously appeared above her head. The priest, recognizing this as a sign from God, gave her Communion. Immediately after receiving Jesus in the Eucharist, Imelda died in ecstasy, united with her Lord. She is the patron saint of First Communicants.
